I finally have a summarized experience of this game:

Playing as Killer: ez gg

Playing as survivor: slow useless noisy repairmen

o jogo Ã© bom mas quando vocÃŠ tem amigos que sÃ£o horriveis e nÃ£o duram 3 segundos com o killer vc perde por osmose, entÃ£o procure amiguinhos bons para jogar com vcs e quando o killer tiver NOED vÃ¡ ao perfil dele e spamme CORNO e PINTO no perfil dele eh isto

Really thought I could get back into this game but it gets really repetitive and boring REAL QUICK. 

If there is anything that bothers me, its the concept that Killers rely on hitting their prey with x weapon but if they MISS their target, their really isn't much of a delay to allow the victim to get away. Just finish animation and continue chase with a boost in speed. 

They get a speed boost for just about everything and if they got the set of META perks then good luck as survivor cus your chances of living are below 15%. 

Maybe its the map design or something else but in my last game, I managed to avoid a hit from the killer only to have him finish his animation and quickly catch up to me and hit me once and for all....Like that was my opening to escape but instead it just delayed the inevitable. Nice.

I feel like this game requires players to cheese all the mechanics to some degree in order to escape and that honestly just sucks.

Something isn't right and I feel like their should be more ways to actually get away from a chase. The longer it goes on the faster the killers becomes and it's like the only way to get away is to literally zig-zag the killer into becoming an idiot and losing track which really isn't easy to do considering their barely any fog or "Darkness" or anything else besides a wooden plank to fall over in front of the killer. Shame, the concept looked good on paper but the execution was far from perfect. If the game made players rely on their keen senses rather than simply forcing players to get the META set of Perks then the game would have more 'Skill' involved with it. 

After years of being out and this is STILL the same as when it started...just a Shame, dam Shame.

The devs don't care about the community. They always give more power to killer, and less tu survivor. The game is almost impossible as a survivor. Playing the killer is way to easy tho. This is not the worst. The matchmaking is the most stupide thing I ever seen. I'm rank 20 (the lowest possible) and I'm rank agaisnt a rank 4? Of course I loose and had no fun. Of course I couldn't do anything, the other player is way higher than me. That make no sense. But who cares? they are making money.

By far the most toxic community I've dealt with. I've played LoL and CSGO but didn't have to make my profile private so people didn't fucking harass me through profile comments. My very first game I was accused of lag switching and was reported by all 4 survivors, and unless you lose, you will ALWAYS be accused of cheating as a killer who wins. A couple games later, after I got 2 kills, everyone disconnected, ending the game early and cutting my XP.

As a killer, you will almost ALWAYS face a 4 stack of friends, NOT random idiots like your teammates when you solo queue. As a killer, you are ALWAYS at a disadvantage. Survivors are OP but the devs are biased so they won't nerf them, therefore strategies such as "looping" are viable; AKA running around a pallet until the killer hits them or gives up (the latter is usually the best option, which is fucking stupid). Survivors SHOULD have a small speed debuff while turning a corner, so then looping isn't possible and survivors have to actually use skill to win, but of course skill ruins the game if you're a survivor. 

It's a fun game but you have to really enjoy the genre and have thick skin because people will do literally anything they can to ruin your fun. As of writing, I have under 8 hours of gameplay (Half that looking for a damn game) and have been harassed on my profile by people with 5k+ hours.

This game was entertaining as balls at first.
Despite the near-constant dying, I had oodles of giggling fun running around as a survivor against all the scary pop-culture villains; the tension you get when you have a good game going is weirdly delightful and fun to chat about afterwards with the guy that just killed you on a meat hook as you exchange pleasantries in the post-game lobby. GG sir, GG.
But then I decided to try my hand at playing a killer and the giggling stopped after 5-6 matches, the fun already a distant memory.
It honestly felt like I was playing a different game, with an indifferent and often toxic community.
As a killer it can take 5-10 minutes to find a match. This isn't a problem by itself, but when you do finally get a game going you are lucky if half the players are at your skill level. It is supremely soul-crushing to hook a player only to have his buddies run circles around you and unhook him seconds later as you lumber about feeling like an inept doofus.
I could live with these issues, as chasing people around and whacking them with various murder sticks is still great fun and I had a couple games where I came damn close to killing someone, despite the experience gap. (Still haven't killed anyone btw which is part of the frustration when the daily quest is to do just that)
But all it takes is ONE player with the right (or wrong) mindset to ruin the killers day.
Which brings me to the real nonsense that killed this game for me: pallet looping.
Pallet looping is something that was invented by players hell-bent on ruining the experience for all of the neophyte murderers.
Without using specific killers whose abilities counter it, this 'tactic' is effectively impossible to deal with when employed by even moderately competent players, let alone these evil trolls with way too many hours in the game. (I have 14 at the time of this review).
When faced with a pallet looper, you can forget about the wonderful game of cat and mouse you thought you were playing: instead try to find a way to have fun while running in circles after a shirtless wonder in bright green track pants who t-bags every pallet you destroy in your vain bid to catch the miserable trolling toad. (I might still be salty about that one)
Overall, great game to play with friends or as a survivor, but the long match-making and inability to have fun as a killer leaves half of the game sorely lacking, and since half a game isnâ€™t enough to satisfy me this is a firm â€˜do not buyâ€™.

UPDATE:
Another thing to add, as you get into the higher levels more and more people will quit if they are the first person the killer catches, thus screwing over the killer AND the other survivors. Since this keeps happening, I have to assume the devs don't care despite the ability to report people for doing it.
Long match-making + quitters = barf.
